content:
8, 2016
												Prison Architect is a fun builder/management sim.  The best way to describe my fascination with it is that it's like watching an ant farm with all the ants in little orange jumpsuits.+Freedom to design your prison in whatever way you wish.  Nice extras like time-sensitive guard scheduling and automated doors and cameras.  You can reform through punishment or reform programs.  Still has monthly updates even after release.  Tons of mods.-Campaign is pretty short (I don't mind, I'm here for the sandbox).  There is no way to automate searching prisoners or cells.  Depending on your PC, performance can be an issue once you start approaching 1000 inmates.Overall, great sim game.  Hours of enjoyment to be had.

content:
3, 2016
												This game has very few rules. 1.  Hold prisoners for thier allotted time.2. Try not to get too many killed in any one day.3.  Profit.This is a management sim/sandbox. Primarily, you will be building and designing rooms, managing your employees, and running an intelegence network.  How your prisoners are treated is really up to you; you can be the reformer or the punisher.Gameplay itself can be changed when you first create a new prison.  You can choose your warden, prisoner genders, gang presence, weather effect, and random events.  Even though Prisoner Achitect is out of early access, the developers still add content every now and then.  Be sure to check the community page when you see an update and check out their announcement and demonstration video.Edit:  Since I posted this review, the developers issued thier final update (giving dev shortcuts).  The game has taken on a different dynamic for me.   While it was in early access, I would essentially be playing a new prison with a new challenge level every month as it was updated.   I think that was the most fun for me.  I still love the game, but expect this to be the finished article.  It's wonderful and challenging, but not as dynamic as an experience as it was in early access.

There is also a gamemode where you can Escape from your own prison or that one you downloaded from the workshop. I never get bored in this awesome game and can not hate it. I saw every update coming and tried everything and in my opinion it is an finished game! This is truly a 10/10 game!

content:
, 2016
												Like all simulation games, they do get boring at some point. Even with all of the random events and such enabled, you can still lose interest quickly, but for under $10 on the summer sale? Definitely worth it. It's very fun once you start playing, and quite unpredictable, but it would be nicer if there was even more challenge. The only significant challenge I've faced is not being able to afford new cells when more prisoners come in, which even then isn't a big deal because you have a holding cell.I recommend this game to anyone looking for an alternative gaming experience. A break from the shooters and adventure games, and go back to a classical management game. It may not be totally worth the listing price unless you're a die hard fan of these types of games and can play them for weeks, but like I said, it's a steal for 75% off.

content:
ber 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								I highly recommend this game to anyone that likes strategy games and grid-based design games. I have had 1000+ hours of literal non-stop fun so far from this game. This game LACKS the ability to be boring, as you can always restart and try again. It's extremely easy to mod and I would recommend this to anyone that wants to learn how to Lua code. It's far more stable and less buggy than Garry's Mod. Garry's Mod is a buggy mess outright in itself; I've had one or two bugs ever happen in this game (Prison Architect) over two years of playing it, with over 1,000 hours (steam/normal version combined).This game is great for anyone, and there's tablet versions for those without their computer at hand. Introversion makes enjoyable games, Uplink and Prison Architect being my favorites, then Darwinia. If they continue work with Subversion, and they complete it to full, it could be an amazing game. Or, Uplink 2.0? That'd be cool.Pros/Cons (Cons are exagurated, so take with a grain of salt, but they aren't that bad and the gameplay and replayability of this game is worth more than any kind of con this game has).Pros:Great GameplayMods via WorkshopPrisons via WorkshopCommunity is decent (the website forum is full of ♥♥♥♥♥♥s, especially the moderators, steam community is better)Amazing Lua capabilitiesBuilt in computer logic set pieces ('remote control' research option)Cons:-Starts to lag like hell with 200+ AI's on the map (30-45fps with oc 4.1ghz fx-6300), you're going to need a decent processor (high-end i3, i5, i7, fx-6300, fx-8350)-No multiplayer, but I can see that being a bigger issue than it would be worth (how would pathfinding be handled? servers? host? if peer-to-peer, it could kill the hosts computer from the possibility of too much AI)-Needs better multi-threading, or 64-bit. Lag issues could be killed permanently if either of these were introduced. 64-bit would kill the lag harder than more cores, though.

content:
2, 2014
Early Access Review
								There I was, I had just put some money onto my Steam Wallet to prepare for the amazement that is the Steam Summer Sale, I was pondering for many moments, browsing the front page. I knew I wanted a game but which game. I'm on a Mac you see so not many games are available. Prison Architect was there though. I was questioning my mate  (I later found out that he had no previous experience with the game) and he just said "If you want." I responded with, "Of course I want!" And thusly proceeded to acquire Prison Architect in the usual fashion.I ordered a pizza and let the game download, presuming it would take my 'terrible' internet a while to download. I was surprised to find that the game was simply 150 MB in size and my 'terrible' internet was able to download it in a matter of minutes. I went onto it. Tried to change around with the settings, being in a Skype call and having the game sounds blaring into your ears wasn't the greatest thing. With that tweak well and truly sorted I moved on to play the game.The first thing the game asked me to do was to build an execution room and I was already excited. Have you always wanted to build a room to kill all those that wronged? Then this is the game for you! Having completed the introduction I thought I was ready to move onto larger and greater things... I've never been so wrong in my life before.I went onto load up a world in all it's default gloryness. Built the usual holding cell, office, canteen and kitchen. Proceeded to hire a warden, one million guards and two cooks. Then the normal risk prisoners arrived. I was there in all my naivety believing the guards would able to handle these prisoners... again, I've never been so wrong in my life before.Trying to pimp out the kitchen when a red sign pops up saying '1..2...3...4..5...6...7 prisoners escaped'. I immediately scanned the area, spotting out the escapees and bringing them back to justice. Turns out, the guards would rather fight a guy inside the holding cell as opposed to capturing those who flee. It was a dead end and I had to plow on.In the end, I just turned out to be really bad at the game and as much as I found it difficult it truly is an enjoyable game. I do recommend you buy it this sale or if not buy it whenever.

Early Access Review
								With the game about to have it's offical relase October 6th I thought I would update my review. This is how you do early access correctly. Every month for the past 3 years there has been an update with new, sometimes game changing, content added. Since I started playing things like armed gaurds, dogs, a prison grading system, prisoner traits, reform programs, gangs and most recently random events, have all been added to this game. It still amazes me that such a small team has made this game. I really can't recommend this game enough. I have more hours in this game than I do in any other. I can't believe I spent 30 dollars and got 500+ hours of entertainment from this game.

content:
0, 2016
												This game is a Prison Simulator, built around housing and caring for the needs of your inmates. The systems in the game are very complex, yet easy to understand after some time spent with them. The needs of the prisoners are built really well as no prison thinks the exact same, and each has their personal levels of emotion. Each prisoner has his own story and outside family. You can run your prison in any style or fashion you want; from one staffed by armed guards with a truly hellish environment to a luxury prison, built around comfort of inmates. I truly enjoyed this game. I would recommend going through a bit of the campaign first to understand some of the basic operations of the prison. 9/10

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
y 10, 2015
Early Access Review
								Prison Architect is an early access prison simulator similar to Roller Coaster Tycoon, Simcity, or the like.  It has elements of sandbox/construction with managed tiers for punishment, rehabilitation, kitchen menu etc... right down to micromanaging each hour of each prisoner's day.  You can decide to create the most horrific environment for your prisoners... or maybe you want to excel at rehabilitation & prisoner "recovery".  Either way the well stocked options provide freedoms to the user that all simulation games should have... most of the features seem to work already!  Game play is kind of "real" ... with comic book style scene transitions & backstories.  However if you can get past the prison thing and just "play the game" it is very enjoyable and addictive.  Though this is an early access game it is totally payable in it's current state.If you like simulation/sandbox/management style games... or enjoyed any of the "Tycoon" series of games... this is one with a more serious story line/undertones (you can skip the scenes also).  Definitely worth checking out.

content:

Early Access Review
								Prison Architect is 'different' to most strategy games out there. It is still an alpha (15/06/2014) however the game seems almost completed! The game has so much potential-some of which it has already forfillled. The glitches, such as prisoners remain seated and act as normal when a deadly fire is in the room, make the game hilarious and laughable. Even if it is an alpha it does what a game is ment to do; entertain you. It isnt severly incompleted. Eveything in the game works flawlessly-most of the time-and you forget it is an alpha. Also there are fun glitches/things, e.g. the prisons sit on the blade of a saw in the workshop as they are using it, the prison jail doors get overwhelmed with people trying to get through and the guards can't open it for them so for hours your prisons are waiting at a door!The gamemakers (introversion softwere) also go very in-depth with detain in some parts of the game. An example of this is the attention to detail to the prisons. Each is given a name, picture, list of convictions e.g. how many years served (and what for) and how many years to serve(and what for), also family, security level, #ref number, recent status, activity, mood, condition, experiance, punishment/security grading, bio and more. You can also make your own character by purchasing the 'Name in Game' upgrade dcl which allows you to create your own character which could even be based on you with your name!The only complaint I have is the price, especially of the 'Name in Game' upgrade dcl. I find that £15 for your name and bio in-game isnt worth £15. And that's just for name in the game, if you want the game as well it is just short of £35. The game (only) is £20. This game does not have good graphic qualitly however for a game like this you don't want nor need it as the graphics suit the game perfectly. Overall, it is a great game and introversion have done well-so far. I would reccormend you buy this games as if you like strategy, organisation and building this game is perfect. It is worth the £20 sale price. I would also highly recommend you upgrade the game with the 'Name in Game' dcl ONLY DURING A SALE(personally £15 is over-expensive). This is an exellant game with everything I would expect in it and more. I cannot wait to see what the game developers have instore in the next update! (Alpha 22) Great game-buy it!
